did.abstract: Carlo Tresca (1879-1943), was an Italian-born anarchist, who emigrated to the United States in 1904. He was a labor organizer, a journalist, and the editor of several Italian language radical newspapers. An opponent of both fascism and Stalinism, he was assassinated in New York City in 1943. The collection consists of a 344 pp. undated typescript, titled "Autobiography," which covers his life and political activities through the 1920s.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carlo Tresca (1879-1943), was an Italian-born anarchist, who emigrated to the United States in 1904. He was a labor organizer, including with the Industrial Workers of the World, a journalist, and editor, notably of Il Proletario, the official newspaper of the Italian Socialist Federation, and of Il Martello, an anti-fascist newspaper. An opponent of both fascism and Stalinism, he was assassinated in New York City in 1943.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a 344 pp. undated typescript, titled "Autobiography," which covers his life and political activities through the 1920s. It was typed by his second wife, Margaret De Silver Trescca.
